result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony C. MARTINEZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Order for Modifying Defendant's Bail
It is hereby ordered, for the reasons placed on the record, the above captioned defendant's bail is modified from $1,500.00 to $750.00.  All other conditions remain the same.
$750.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing. 
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference set for 05-16-14 at 10:30 a.m. in Branch 3.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery. 
MOTION FOR BAIL MODIFICATION
Counsel argue.  Court modifies bail to $750.00 cash with the same conditions.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 05-07-14 at 1:45 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of burglary and 2 counts bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-05-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department, daily, by 4:00 p.m. and that he have no contact with Diane Martinez and with the residence at 1222 S. 7th Street, Manitowoc, WI or with Game Stop located in Manitowoc,WI.  Cash bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
